    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static RemoteMetadataProvider getInstance(Context context)
        Returns instance of RemoteMetadataProvider
        Parameters:
        context - Current application context. This is required to get instance of AudioManager.
        Returns:
        Active instance of RemoteMetadataProvider.

      • acquireRemoteControls

        public void acquireRemoteControls()
        Acquires remote media controls. This method MUST be called whenever your View displaying metadata is shown or else you will not receive metadata updates and probably you won't be able to send media commands.

      • dropRemoteControls

        public void dropRemoteControls()
        Drops remote media controls. This method MUST be called whenever your View displaying metadata is hidden or else you may block other applications working with remote media controls.

      • getCurrentClientIntent

        public Intent getCurrentClientIntent()
                              throws NameNotFoundException
        Returns:
        Intent for launching current player or null if there is no current client.
        Throws:
        NameNotFoundException - This exception will be thrown in case the launch intent for current player can't be found.

      • getCurrentClientPendingIntent

        public PendingIntent getCurrentClientPendingIntent()
        Returns current client media events receiver in form of PendingIntent.
        Returns:
        Current client media events receiver or null if there is no client.

      • getLooper

        public Looper getLooper()
        Returns user-defined Looper.
        Returns:
        user-defined Looper or null if default is used.

      • getOnArtworkChangeListener

        public OnArtworkChangeListener getOnArtworkChangeListener()
        Returns the registered callback for artwork change event.
        Returns:
        The callback or null if there is nothing registered.

      • getOnMetadataChangeListener

        public OnMetadataChangeListener getOnMetadataChangeListener()
        Returns the registered callback for metadata change event.
        Returns:
        The callback or null if there is nothing registered.

      • getOnPlaybackStateChangeListener

        public OnPlaybackStateChangeListener getOnPlaybackStateChangeListener()
        Returns the registered callback for playback state change event.
        Returns:
        The callback or null if there is nothing registered.

      • getOnRemoteControlFlagsChangeListener

        public OnRemoteControlFeaturesChangeListener getOnRemoteControlFlagsChangeListener()
        Returns the registered callback for remote control features change event.
        Returns:
        The callback or null if there is nothing registered.

      • removeLooper

        public void removeLooper()
        Tells the RemoteMetadataProvider to stop using the looper. Note that there will be no effect until you call acquireRemoteControls().

      • sendMediaCommand

        public boolean sendMediaCommand(int keyCode)
        Sends input event with the specified keycode to current player.
        Parameters:
        keyCode - Button keycode to send.
        Returns:
        True if event was delivered to player, false otherwise.

      • sendBroadcastMediaCommand

        public void sendBroadcastMediaCommand(int keyCode)
        Sends input event with the specified keycode system-wide in form of Broadcast. Use this method only in case there is no active clients and you want to try to initialize one. If there is active client, use sendMediaCommand(int) instead. Please note that not all players support this.
        Parameters:
        keyCode - Button keycode to send.

      • sendBroadcastMediaCommand

        public void sendBroadcastMediaCommand(MediaCommand command)
        Sends input event with the specified MediaCommand system-wide in form of Broadcast. Use this method only in case there is no active clients and you want to try to initialize one. If there is active client, use sendMediaCommand(MediaCommand) instead. Please note that not all players support this.
        Parameters:
        command - MediaCommand to send.

      • isClientActive

        public boolean isClientActive()
        Check if remote media client is active(e.g. can receive media events and provide metadata).
        Returns:
        true if there is remote media client to send events to and false otherwise.

      • sendMediaCommand

        public boolean sendMediaCommand(MediaCommand command)
        Sends input event with the specified MediaCommand to current player.
        Parameters:
        command - MediaCommand enum with necessary action.
        Returns:
        True if event was delivered to player, false otherwise.

      • setCurrentClientPendingIntent

        public void setCurrentClientPendingIntent(PendingIntent pintent)
        Sets current client PendingIntent. Should not be used manually unless you sure you are holding the right PendingIntent to send events to.

      • setLooper

        public void setLooper(Looper looper)
        Sets looper to be used to process messages. Please note that effect
        Parameters:
        looper - Looper to be used

      • setOnArtworkChangeListener

        public void setOnArtworkChangeListener(OnArtworkChangeListener l)
        Register a callback to be invoked when artwork should be updated.
        Parameters:
        l - The callback that will run.

      • setOnMetadataChangeListener

        public void setOnMetadataChangeListener(OnMetadataChangeListener l)
        Register a callback to be invoked when metadata should be updated.
        Parameters:
        l - The callback that will run.

      • setOnPlaybackStateChangeListener

        public void setOnPlaybackStateChangeListener(OnPlaybackStateChangeListener l)
        Register a callback to be invoked when playback state should be updated.
        Parameters:
        l - The callback that will run.

      • setOnRemoteControlFeaturesChangeListener

        public void setOnRemoteControlFeaturesChangeListener(OnRemoteControlFeaturesChangeListener l)
        Register a callback to be invoked when remote control features should be updated.
        Parameters:
        l - The callback that will run.
